intro: Licania microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaf licania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Licania microphylla is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
